verses.verse: Don't rebuke an elder, instead plead with him like a father, [and] the younger men like brothers,
the older women like mothers, the younger women like sisters with all purity.
Honor widows who are really widows.

But if any widow has children or descendants, then let them learn to show their religious responsibility to their own family and to repay their parents, for that is good and acceptable in God's sight.
Now she, who is really a widow and left alone, trusts in God and continues with requests and prayers day and night,
but she, who lives in luxury, is dead even while she lives.
Communicate these instructions, so they may be blameless.
Now if any does not provide for his own and especially those of his own family, he has denied the faith and is worse than an infidel.
Do not let a widow be enrolled less than 60 years old having been the wife of one man,

having a good reputation for good deeds, and if she has raised children, if she has been hospitable to strangers, if she has washed the feet of God's people, if she has helped the afflicted, if she has diligently followed every good deed.
Refuse the younger widows, for when their strong sensual desires alienate them from Christ, they will marry,
[and] have condemnation, because they have rejected their first faith.
Along with this, they learn to be lazy wandering from house to house, and not only lazy but gossips and busybodies talking about things they shouldn't.
Therefore I want the younger women to marry, bear children, manage the household, and give no opportunity to the adversary to bitterly denounce us.
Some have already turned aside to follow Satan.
If any believing man or woman have widows, let them help them and don't let the congregation be burdened, so that it may help those who are really widows.
Let the elders, who do a good job of being in charge, be deserving of double honor, especially those who labor in word and teaching.
For the Scripture says, "You must not muzzle the ox who threshes the grain," and, "The laborer is worthy of his pay."
Do not accept an accusation against an elder, except from two or three witnesses.
Those who sin rebuke before all, so the others may also fear.
I testify before God, the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that you obey these things without prejudice doing nothing by favoritism.
Do not lay hands on any man too hastily, or be a partaker of other men's sins. Keep yourself pure.
Do not be a water drinker only, but use a little wine for your stomach's sake and your frequent illnesses.
Some people's sins are obvious before judgment, but for others [it is] later on.
In the same way the good deeds [of some] are obvious and those [done] in other ways cannot be hidden.
